Fields.MenuText: How much further until we can launch?
We need to launch now, Volta. Give me some numbers!
Those Morganas will get out of range quickly. We have to make a move!

Fields.DialogueText: Not too far, Capitaine!
30 clicks and counting!
Détendez-vous, Capitaine! Those Morganas aren't even the speedy ones...
All right, update me.
Target's in range in 10 clicks... nine... eight... seven...
Fire torpedos!
HAAAA-HA-HA! FIRING!
Hehehe - Formidable.
Incoming transmission for Madame Volta!
Oh? Hand it here, Officer.
... Brace yourselves...
... "and hopefully your behavior this time fares better than the last... Ambassador Jaccoud sends his regards."
Um... Volta...
Captain... ?
You're dismissed, Seaman Bauldun. And hurry.
Hope that I behave better?Ambassador Jaccoud... sends. His. Regards?! Ce misérable morceau de--
*ALARM*
Save it for the battle, Volta!!
AAAAAAHHHHHHH!!!
@BATTLE
Volta, we're running out of time!
Hey, Volta, would you like to explain what's up between you and the Ambassador?
Well, since you asked--
*ALARM*
Clearly it must wait. Don't worry, though, I won't forget my ire!
@BATTLE
Sends damn regards... I'll! Show! Him! Regards!
Volta... Volta! I'm pretty sure that fish is dead. You can stop beating it now.
What? Oh. I suppose it is.
... I'm sorry about the transmission.
Thank you. Me too... I just HATE that it gets to me...

Fields.MenuText: I understand... the Marine Nationale really holds you to the highest of standards, yeah?
And I don't like the way they treat you. If I wasn't a Captain, I'd... well... you know what I'm getting at.
It'll be all right, Volta. You have me and the crew and we'll always be behind you.

Fields.DialogueText: Bien sûr. And I LOVE them! I know what I am. I know what I do. But whatever I succeed in is never enough... here, sprinkle lemon juice over this.
Deck them? HA! I'd pay to see that. Hand me the rosemary!
If you say so, Capitaine... ei, hand me the salt.
When will our guest arrive?
Never, hopefully... she didn't really say.
Great. Can't wait to meet her - she sounds charming.
Charming. Not the word I'd use, but... okay.
But at least it's not Jaccoud this time. That's got to be a good thing.
Henh. I've heard enough about Batteux to keep my expectations low.
Are you serious?
Well... why not?
Because they're just minding their own business?
Right... but they're still on the enemy's side. Who knows what kind of stuff they have!
Eeiiii... Capitaine, what's been going on with you?

Fields.MenuText: What do you mean? Never knew I had such a... dangerous side, hm?
Oh nothing... Living life on the edge.
Oh, come on! What's wrong with you, Volta? Fish not biting enough?

Fields.DialogueText: Well... you're commanding a destroyer while at war, so... what are you getting at?
W... what? Oh... okay, then... maybe I'll hide the ale next time...
NO! Actually, they aren't! UGH!
Gotta entertain yourself on these calm scenes, right?
Aye, but why waste our resources?
Waste a few small resources for something bigger! Just think of the research they have. The transcripts... codes... new possible gadgets?
... Merde...
All right! Full speed ahead!!
@BATTLE
It looks like we have another fight on our hands before we can raid that ship.
I won't be dissuaded from my plan! Battle stations!
@BATTLE
So... we raided that ship so you could impress her?
You say that like it's a bad thing.
Captain!
It paid off well, didn't it? I didn't hear anyone, especially you, complain about the extra alcohol rations...
I... haha, yeah... you're right, Captain.
Quiet! Here she comes.
Capitaine! Oh, Officer Huan! Enjoying the sunshine?
Aye, madame! We were just talking about the spoils from the raid.

Fields.MenuText: Aye! Like the alcohol. Hope you're enjoying the extra bottles of wine, Volta. Anything else strike your fancy?
Ahh, yes! I'm guessing you're drowning in research?
Still haven't found anything interesting, Volta?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh of course! And the cooking wine? I may use that soon. And... no, nothing else!
Mmm... Nope! Pas du tout.
Not yet! Although some of the spices we snagged are marvelous!
Really, now... ?
I'll see you for a tactics discussion later, Capitaine.
That went well, right?
... Sure, Captain. Sure.
Hm...
The wind?
Oui. Which means the waves...
Good thing we refueled.
Exactly. We need to lock down tight and steady. The winds are picking up fast!
I'll sound the call. How long do you think we'll be caught up in this damn thing?
I can't quite say. I haven't heard from the other Belles around here just yet, but I'm waiting.

Fields.MenuText: Do you think the Morganas will still try and attack?
Stay alert. We never know when the Morganas will attack.
I'll have someone readily on comms in case any Belles try and make contact.

Fields.DialogueText: I've seen it before, I'll seen it again. They won't stop. Elles sont folles!
Definitely. They are some sneaaaakkyyy gals.
Even if the messages are broken up, I'll find a way to interpret them.
*ALARM*
Speak of the devil...
And THEY shall come!
@BATTLE
FIRE!!!
FIRING! IF THAT'S WHAT YOU SAID!
WHAT? THE RAIN AND THUNDER ARE TOO LOUD!
NO! THIS IS NOT A DUNDER SHROUD!

Fields.MenuText: WHAT? JUST... FLANK SPEED!
THE TORPEDOES! DEPLOY OUR TORPEDOES!
JUST FIRE THE TURRETS!

Fields.DialogueText: WHAT'S A PLANK SCREED?
IT'S A LITTLE LATE TO BE INCOGNITO!
I'm not even going to try and decipher that...
This isn't working, is it?
Wait, what are we doing? I'll just use my light for Morse code!
"This... is... not... a... dunder... shrou... " What??
"... Just... fire... any... weapons... you... can... damn... it... " OH. WELL, WHY DIDN'T YOU SAY SO?!
WHAT??
@BATTLE
Rogers!
Aye, Captain!
Check over the inventory for bullets.
Mais, Capitaine, I already--
Specifically, the tracers... and you'll need to count by twos. Once you're halfway, count by eighths.
Um... eighths, Captain?
You heard me. Get on it!
Uh... aye-aye, Captain!
So... what was that about?
He left his damn gun on the ground.
Oh, merde.
You know how I feel about that.
Oui. C'est--

Fields.MenuText: Dangerous! He knows better than that!
Disrespectful, first of all! Let him do it just one more time...
Despicable! We don't know what'll hit us out there!

Fields.DialogueText: Aye, he does! Pretty great punishment... eighths? Really?
Then he shall walk the plank, aye! ... No?
Exactly. The Morganas have been rough lately, haven't they?
Next I'll have him scrub down the latrines with a toothbrush...
... A soft toothbrush.
@BATTLE
Hey, Capitaine, I think maybe you should rethink your punishment, making Rogers clean the latrines with a toothbrush.
Why do you suddenly object?
Because someone else left one of them a horrible stinking mess, and I want it cleaned faster. Especially since I need to use them, too.
*ALARM*
I'll see that it gets done by the time you're done with this battle.
@BATTLE
Hmm...
I was right, wasn't I?
About... ?
That ship we raided! I was right. You found something didn't you?
Pfft, HA! I found... nothing. Nothing at all...
Is that why you've been holed up in your quarters, surrounded by books and... what is that smell? How much wine have you had? Have you found anything useful?
Fine! You caught me. You're lucky you're Capitaine, you know... and lucky that I value you more than my pride.

Fields.MenuText: Aww, you value me? What a sweet thing to say!
What a great compliment! I know how much you value your pride...
Huh, thanks, Volta! I... thi-- you know what? Let's just leave it at that.

Fields.DialogueText: Your RESPECT! I value your respect...
Oh, tais-toi, Capitaine! Yeesh!
Hehe. Good choice, Capitaine.
So... you going to tell me?
Non!
Dammit, Volta...
Just kidding! We're looking at plans for a proximity fuze. Actually... these are British plans. Looks like the Morganas are trying to put their own spin on it...
And now it's in our hands... I'll assign a crew to start working on these plans. You radio out to some of the British Belles.
Ugh... why would I want to do that?
Ah! Volta, what a lovely surprise!
But you've seen me up here plenty of times. This is where I fish...
... Right. So, how're they biting?
They aren't!
Ah, too bad...
Oui... too bad...

Fields.MenuText: Sooo... sun's out. It looks nice on you - I mean. Wow. Great start. You know what I mean.
Yeah. I mean, it's too bad... you're great at fishing so I uh... wouldn't be surprised if they were... um... intimidated by you.
... Nice fishing pole. I like the way it matches your... eyes.

Fields.DialogueText: I... hehe... thanks?
Hehehe! Thank you... Capitaine, I... haha... wow. HAHAHA, is this what being at loss for words is like? I... I don't like it.
Um... yeah, it's new! Thanks? I, um... how much have you had to drink, Capitaine?
ANYWAY-
Heya, Captain! Volta!
Really?
Houston! Come! You've done well in my kitchen. You should relax with us!
Again, really?
Sure! Thank you, Madame!
... What fun.
@BATTLE
Capitaine. We have Morgana squads coming in hot! And reports suggest that we may have a couple more incoming within a few hours.
Roger that. I'll call for the crew to scramble after we come up with some sort of plan.
Bien!
How's the proximity fuze coming along?
OOooohhhh-hoooo-ho oui. It's ready, Capitaine.
Excellent - we may have to use it...
Bauldun! Houston! Front and center!!
Aye, Ma'am!
Make sure to add the proximity fuzes to our fire control systems. I'll direct-control them myself, and you two manually get on our other turrets on the off-chance the other Morganas get too close.
Aye Ma'am! Cockley and I will ready the computer and double-check coordinates for you.

Fields.MenuText: How many fuzes do we have?
How far until we hit the Morganas on our radar?
Damn, I can't wait to see these babies in action... If these work... just imagine what we can do!

Fields.DialogueText: So far, these are our only ones, with one more to further my research. I'll make sure they hit them hard!
Thousands of feet! But these are our prototypes. I'll have torpedoes on standby just in case these don't make it far enough.
Oh, they're going to work, Capitaine! They better!! The Marine Nationale will write about this for YEARS.
All right, fire on my mark!
@BATTLE
I'm not sure the fuzes made as much difference to combat performance as a Belle backing up the computers - but at least they didn't hurt.
I just sent a 'gram to the Brits, thanking them for inventing such a thing.
Oh? How commendable of you, Volta!
Ahhhhh, shush! I know good warriors when I see them - it's just good form to commend them!
If there are any more systems to test, let me know. Preferably during combat drills rather than a real battle, if only for the reports.
Already ahead of you, Capitaine. But come on! Enough work talk. This is REST and RELAXATION. So a little less chatting, and a little more RELAXING!
... Capitaine.

Fields.MenuText: Ohhhh, fine. Fine. I'm relaxing. See this drink in my hand?
Heh. I'll give that to you. I'm getting more of the shrimp!
Damn right. That's Captain Capitaine to you!

Fields.DialogueText: Formidable. Let's keep them coming!
YES! TWO PLATES!
HA! Captain Capitaine? I suppose it has a nice ring to it.
Do you think it'll catch on?
Do you really want me to answer that?
... Pass me that drink, will you?
@BATTLE
Capitaine, I have a fun idea. I know a spot of the ocean around here that is great for fishing. Permission to sail there?
*ALARM*
It seems I will have to decline permission. Maybe later.
@BATTLE
Is this it?
And... here! The perfect fishing spot... well, my FAVORITE fishing spot.
No kidding, the view itself is beautiful. How'd you find this place?
On one of our leisurely visits on port I found this place riiight before I couldn't take another step. We still had time, so of course I began fishing... and, well...
The rest is history.
Exactement... anyway. Here. Here! Take your pole. Show me what ya got!
I'm always up for the challenge... okay here we go!
Ei! That one must be huge! Reel it in! Hurry up and reel it in!
No wait, not yet! I got it! Just... just hold on!!
Capitaine, cut it loose! Cap...  Capitaine, you're going to fall... Capitaine!!
... Don't even sta--
BAAAAHAHAHAHA!!! You okay down there swimming with the fish?!?!

Fields.MenuText: This isn't f-f-f-funny... this water... IT'S FREEZING!!
All of this for a fish?! Gah! My foot just touched something!
I am never... fishing... AGAIN!

Fields.DialogueText: Hehehehehe... I'll - hehehe - I'll throw you a heavy blanket!
You tried so hard, though! Hehehe!
Hehehe... HAHA... hehe! Yeah, right, Capitaine.
Favorite fishing spot, eh? I'm soaking here!
Hehe... so adorable...
Hm?
Oh! Rien... nothing...
Volta... ?

Fields.MenuText: Sharpening those knives of yours, I see. Planning on using them?
So... those knives. Those don't happen to be for the ambassador, right?
Those knives look sharp enough! But you aren't going to use them for fishing, are you?

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe oui... maybe non... who knows? Hehehe...
Well... what if I say no?
These knives are meant to cut thicker meats... and of course not! I have a special knife for my fish.
Volta...
... I don't want another coward onboard.
You know civilian life is different than ours!
Then maybe the ambassador shouldn't come!
Now you know that's--
But we'll see how it goes, won't we?
Y... yeah. I'll go see how the crew is doing while preparing the party...
Besides, they needed sharpening anyway!
@BATTLE
Ambassador Angeline Batteux on deck!
Here we go...
Be nice.
Ambassador Batteux, welcome aboard!
Oui! Welcome, Madame Batteux!
... Bonjour.
Um... here! Please, right this way. Volta was in charge of the feast we've prepared for you! Tell her, Volta.
... Right. Bon! I know that you enjoy the finest of seafood, so I've prepared plenty of fish, crab, mussels, and other specialties for you!
Mm, my travels were a bit... rough. A glass of wine would be sound.
*ALARM*
Quick! Officer! Get the Ambassador to safety! Don't worry, Madame - you'll be safe aboard Volta.
I better be. We have heard about Volta's... barbaric ways.
Barbaric? Eeiiii--
Barbaric? I'd have to disagree, Madame. Volta's assertive. Quick on her feet! Don't get me started on her research!
Mm...
Thank you, Capitaine...
@BATTLE
I've even dipped into my own personal wine stash for some of the best.
She's the best damn Belle that the Marine Nationale has to offer. Excuse my language.
*ALARM*
And now she gets to see it.
Finally... some time alone.
Alone, hm?
Yeah! You know, away from... the noise.
But the party is really hopping off!

Fields.MenuText: It was! But... it's a little peaceful here, don't you think?
Oh and we'll get back to it! I just wanted to... speak to you... alone...
I'm definitely getting another drink! But, I wanted to... enjoy some time with you... is all.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah... tu as raison. It's... it's nice...
What of, Capitaine?
HA-- Oh... oh, really? Um... hehe, okay...
You look amaz--
Oh, dear! Was I interrupting something?
Oui.
What she means is... well...
Mm... a Captain and a Belle having relations...
Well, hold on there!
There are no relations between us, Ambassador.
... Right. Right, exactly. HA! Please... BAH!
Okay, I get it!
@BATTLE
Hm... I'm staying!
Ahhh, come on! Don't be a wuss. Hit on that queen! Vite! Vite!
Hey! Why don't I... I don't know, play blackjack the way I want to?
Hmph. Have it your way. Lucky lady's on my side... all right. Hit me!
Bust!
Oh, no...
HAHA! What was that, Houston?? I can't hear you over my very own lucky ladies! A pair of queens, baby!

Fields.MenuText: Wow, Officer Houston... maybe you should stick to comms!
Oo... is it a bad time to say there won't be any extra pay for a while?
Lucky lady is not your woman for the night. Need to go lay down for a bit? Think about how much you just lost?

Fields.DialogueText: Hehehe... Next time, Officer Houston? Maybe you should split your hand next time.
HA! Hehehe... Huehuehu-HAHA! Sorry, I'm sorry... ooh, but it's so FUNNY!
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA HAHAHAA!! You should see your face, Houston! Ha, oh no... I'm crying! I'm laughing and crying!
I'll... I'll take my leave now.
Hm... hic! G... gambling aboard a warship?
Ambassador! Well -
Oui! Ambassador... care to join us?
... Really?
Yes, really... did you not count how many glasses of wine she drank? My wine, might I add?
Well... we mayyy ashh well... hic! Do something as we wait forrr t'food...
*ALARM*
Merde!
@BATTLE
That was certainly an inconvenient battle. Good thing we were still drunk instead of hung over while it happened.
Indeed, but NOW it looks like you're QUITE hung over.
Indeed. But--
*ALARM*
Arrrrrgh! It's going to make—bleeeeech!
@BATTLE
How are you feeling, Ambassador?
After my sieste... oui much, much better.
Great! I... hope you didn't have too much to drink?
Oh? Moi? Never!
Mmhm...
I must say that I am very surprised, Madame Belle. This food is divine!
Oh! Thank you, Ambassador. I will gladly send you the recipe--
Although the soup was a bit salty, no?
... And there it is.

Fields.MenuText: Actually, I thought it was salted perfectly. Though... I did notice you added a bit more to it...
It tastes amazing to me. Are you sure you're feeling all right, Ambassador? You were... hitting the wine pretty hard last night...
Hmm... no, it's salted just fine. But I do hear that as you get older, your sense of taste sort of... well...

Fields.DialogueText: Heh...
Hehehehe...
Pffffffft-- HAHA - ehem... hehehe.
HOW DA--
And to admit. I'm not sure you wanted to be here in the first place, Ma'am. I don't allow those who disrespect any of my crew on board... Excuse my disrespect.
Why I... I... harumph!
I... Merci.
So... do you think I can get discharged because of this... ?
Well... Ambassador, I hope you enjoyed your stay...
"Enjoyed" is an overstatement...
Well, I don't expect much praise myself, Ma'am. But that's all on me. Volta did her duties and battled perfectly. Don't let my ego blind your assessment, please.
Mm... Oui. You are right. Madame Belle, you were remarkable. And... please send me your recipe for the soup from the party.
Oh... ! Okay, yes. Thank you, Ambassador Batteux. And I'll make sure to send the recipe as soon as possible!
Safe travels, Ambassador.
ABOUT DAMN TIME! LET'S PARTY... AGAIN! EI! EI!
Freedom feels good, doesn't it?
Aye! Oui! Oui, aye, it does!!
How are you feeling?
... Better. Much better. Thank you again, Capitaine.
Hey, you're a part of this crew. An important part, dammit. And I love you!
You... love me?
Er, yeah! You know! As a part of my crew! Nothing more! HA! That'd be ridiculous. HA!
HA! Yeah... yeah...
... Anyway! Have those reports to me later, and see if we can get a hold of more of those proximity fuzes.
Aye, Capitaine!
@BATTLE
Capitaine... ?
Here!
Ah... bonjour! I've been meaning to talk to you about something...
Of course! What's on your mind?
Well... it's about me being part of this crew...
Ah... you're having doubts.
C'est vrai. But I AM a warrior, a great one! But the Nationale...

Fields.MenuText: Volta, you are impeccable. You've saved our asses countless of times with your quick wit. Ignore the Nationale and listen to me. I believe in you.
To hell what the Nationale has to say! Volta, your intellect and research are the best, bar none. Our tactics keep the Morganas guessing.
Volta, your bravery ASTOUNDS me! Well... scares me, but... it keeps our spirits high and without that? Well, we'd be, uh... Do you know what I mean?

Fields.DialogueText: Merci, Capitaine... thank you. I don't even know what to say...
To hell, hm? Tu as raison! And we connect so well! I'm happy to be your Belle, Capitaine.
Hahaha, I think so, Capitaine. Thank you. I... thank you.
OH! And don't even get me started on your food. I'm glad we have PT every morning.
HA! We might need to double it after our next dinner!
I feel sorry for those saps...
Hehehe! It'll be worth it! I'll see you soon - I need to check on the kitchen crew!
Okay, heart... you can slow down any time now...
*ALARM*
Captain! Volta!
I just read it, Officer Houston!
Report!
Morgana carrier group heading our way!
And I'm sure there are multiple submarines in the vicinity! They could be here within the hour!
Right. Set course to intercept the carrier. If we can get that group cleared out fast, then Asphyxiation or Venom or whoever else is coming at us underwater should be manageable.
D'accord.
Officer Houston, check on our engines. If we need to gun it, Volta and I will need them at top notch!
Aye, Captain!
Listen up, crew! You know what it's like to fight aircraft carriers, and I'm not going to sugarcoat it. But you also know we've fought worse.
Hooyah!
@BATTLE
So get ready for a fight, and then get ready for the party Volta's going to throw after we win!
Battleship group on approach, Volta. Ready?
Alerting the crew now, Capitaine!

Fields.MenuText: After we launch, man those turrets!
Okay, afterwards we're going to gun it and try to move west. We'll get one of them in the middle to take it out.
We're going to need explosives, and a ton of them.

Fields.DialogueText: Ei! You know I love them!
Interesting... let's do it!
Hehehe! Let's hear those babies roar!
FIRE!
... Multiple hits! Looks like we got them on the run early for a... Merde!
Well, that didn't sound good.
Submarine group coming to intercept! Désolée, Capitaine - I don't know how I missed them!
@BATTLE
Is this a trap?
I don't think they'd risk sacrificing a battleship just so we wouldn't see subs coming.
Volta, keep an eye open just in case they try anything unusual - but we engage as normal.
Oui, Capitaine!

Fields.MenuText: Oh, stop it. Nobody expects you to be omniscient.
No harm done, Volta. She's still going down.
No insulting yourself. Captain's orders.

Fields.DialogueText: I do.
C'est vrai.
D'accord, Capitaine. With reservations.
Actually... how close is Vice-Admiral Whitworth's group?
Capitaine?
I'm just thinking how satisfying it would be to have Vanity flanked by an allied battleship group when we move in. Their patrol route's not too far out, yeah?
Capitaine, non!
VOLTA!
@BATTLE
Capitaine...
Somebody get me a damage report, now!
Dammit. Dismissed, Volta. Get yourself checked out.
Capitaine!
Dismissed!
... Oui.
We've reacquired the battleship group, Captain. Looks like Vanity!
So it does.
And she's repaired herself. We don't have the advantage this time. J'étais tellement stupide!
Non?
S'il vous plaît!
It might not be up to us. I don't know what Vanity's got in her engines, but she's pulling away at greater than expected speed.
Without the wind at our backs, I don't think we could overtake her if we tried.
... So what if we lure her in?
Explain.
A minor bit of self-sabotage. I take the engines offline, send up some smoke, look defenseless... the Morganas aren't big on self-control when faced with easy prey.
I don't think I like it.  If we're at a full stop when the shooting starts, we're at a disadvantage. Smoke would be a disaster for visibility. You'd be vulnerable for no particularly good reason.
I'm sorry you feel that way, Capitaine. I may have already initiated the engine shutdown.
Volta, you look like you can barely stand. Sit down so I can yell at you.
Capitaine...
You'd better yell at her later, Captain! You're needed at sick bay!
... You're lucky I can't discharge you.
But, Capitaine, I--
You could be charged with mutiny! You know that?!
But it wasn't....
I don't know what would be worse: you getting sunk with your engines off or you getting reassigned as a training ship because I can't command you properly!
Capitaine!
What?
I'm sorry...
Oh, you're sorry?

Fields.MenuText: Haha! Sorry. You shouldn't have done that in the first place, dammit!
Please. That was reckless...
Sorry? Volta, what if I lost you? I mean... dammit!

Fields.DialogueText: Capitaine, I know I...
I understand, Capitaine, it's just...
Capitaine, I...
Spit it out!
Et tu amo!!
*ALARM*
You... you what?
... We should move.
@BATTLE
... Okay, you getting sunk would be worse. But neither is ideal!
Volta, I...
ATTENDEZ! I'll go!
Oh... okay. Shoot.
I wanted to--
Oh, hell. Fine.
DAMMIT, Capitaine!

Fields.MenuText: I wanted to say that I... um...
Is it getting hotter in here? Whew!
Okay, I can do this... I can do this...

Fields.DialogueText: See? This is why I should've gone first...
You're stalling! Come on! "Shoot" as you say.
What is it, Capitaine?
All right, I love you too! Don't need to twist my arm...
You do... ?
Yes. I do...
*ALARM*
I'd be fine with disabling that alarm...
Do you need it done? I can make that happen.
@BATTLE
What a day...
Formidable! The fish are finally coming to maman!
And not one Morgana in sight...
Please don't curse it! You know I don't like omens...

Fields.MenuText: Ah, come on! Here, I'll pour you another glass of wine.
The weather is nice! Enjoy it while we can... And try this fish! Caught and prepared it myself.
As you said, the fish are biting! Let's catch a batch and make some trades with some other Belles?

Fields.DialogueText: Ahhh, a chilled white... my only weakness!
If we get ambushed... I'm blaming you... Mm! Délicieuse! What's in the sauce??
Oooh... good thinking! I've had my eye on a certain perfume...
Whew! Ha... hold... hold on... I need to... catch my... breath...
What is it, Officer Houston?
Morganas ahead, Madame! I... whew, okay. I would have sounded the alarm but... it isn't working?
Ah! Probably a crewman trying to play a prank...
HA! Some prank... well, we know nothing about that.
Oh, but... I wasn't accusing you, Madame, and Captain. I'm informing you that we're coming up on Morgana ships.It would be great to maybe strike before they sense us?
Right! Right. Right. We'll get right on that. Thank you, Officer. You're dismissed.
I told you... afulo!
Witchcraft? Never!
You ready to scare some Morganas, mon amour?
Heh... lead the way.
